text: Alois Mock (10 June 1934 – 1 June 2017) was a politician. He was a member of the Austrian People's Party (ÖVP). He was Vice Chancellor of Austria from 1987 to 1989. As foreign minister, from 1987 through 1995, he helped take Austria into the European Union. Mock died on 1 June 2017 from complications of Parkinson's disease at the age of 82.Ex-Vizekanzler und VP-Chef Alois Mock gestorben ==References== ==Other websites== *The Global Panel Foundation Category:1934 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Government ministers of Austria Category:People from Lower Austria
title: Alois Mock
